unit_learning_outcomes.description: Discuss linguistic, cultural and ethical issues faced by interpreters working in legal contexts.
Apply discourse analysis and self-reflection to legal interpretations.
Explain the framework of the Australian legal system.
Demonstrate an understanding of the role of a legal interpreter.
Identify and demonstrate appropriate interpreting techniques in different legal contexts.

assessments.description: Four online postings relating unit theory to personal practice

A live dialogic interpreting simulation with either a police officer or a solicitor conducting an interview with a deaf client (actor). This assessment combines performance assessment (teacher marking of all students) with self-analysis for half the class (least experienced in legal interpreting).

assessments.assessment_title: Moot court interpreting and self analysis
assessments.description: A live multi-party court interpreting simulation with a judicial officer, legal representatives and one deaf (actor) plus one hearing (actor) party in a criminal matter. This assessment combines performance assessment (teacher marking of all students) with self-analysis for half the class (most experienced in legal interpreting).
Instead of attending a criminal legal hearing and completing a pro-forma report, students will be asked to watch an uploaded criminal case and then complete the report.
Two open-book short answer quizes relating to civil and criminal legal process

data.description: The aim of this unit is to provide Auslan-English interpreting students with the opportunity to discuss and practice advanced interpreting skills in the specialised area of legal interpreting. Students will analyse the complex linguistic, cultural and ethical challenges of interpreting in legal settings. Students will explore theoretical and practical aspects of the legal system in Australia, legal terminology, the roles of various participants in the legal system, and specific interpretation issues faced by Auslan interpreting practitioners in this domain.
